author: wsjcom
title: Franchisers, Responsibility, Workers Rights
text:
Regarding Andy Puzder’s “A Bad Obama Labor Rule, Resurrected” (op-ed, March 2): The reinstatement of the National Labor Relations Board’s “joint employer” standard is a welcome respite from the Trump administration’s relentless assault on low-wage workers. The standard is essential for establishing who workers are able to bargain with and for holding companies appropriately accountable for instances in which they share control over illegal working conditions.
